Class GhostPieceCalculator

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.logic.GhostPieceCalculator
public class GhostPieceCalculator extends Object
Calculates the landing position (ghost piece) for a brick if it were hard-dropped. Used to display a shadow/preview of where the brick will land.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GhostPieceCalculator(int rows, int[][] boardMatrix)
    Creates a ghost piece calculator for a board with the given dimensions.

    int
    computeLandingY(int startX, int startY, int[][] shape)
    Computes the final Y coordinate where the given shape would land if it were hard-dropped from (startX, startY) straight down.
    void
    updateBoardMatrix(int[][] newBoardMatrix)
    Updates the board matrix reference when the board state changes.

  • Constructor Details

    • GhostPieceCalculator

      public GhostPieceCalculator(int rows, int[][] boardMatrix)
      Creates a ghost piece calculator for a board with the given dimensions.
      Parameters:
      rows - the number of rows in the board
      boardMatrix - the current board state (reference, not copied)

  • Method Details

    • computeLandingY

      public int computeLandingY(int startX, int startY, int[][] shape)
      Computes the final Y coordinate where the given shape would land if it were hard-dropped from (startX, startY) straight down.
      Parameters:
      startX - the starting X coordinate
      startY - the starting Y coordinate
      shape - the brick shape matrix
      Returns:
      the Y coordinate where the brick would land

    • updateBoardMatrix

      public void updateBoardMatrix(int[][] newBoardMatrix)
      Updates the board matrix reference when the board state changes. This is necessary because mergeBrickToBackground() creates a new array.
      Parameters:
      newBoardMatrix - the new board matrix
